windows.symptom: touchpad not working Gurpreet S Please help :)        my touch pad stoped working following a windows update, it doesn't even show up in drivers and devices my laptop is a Gemini NC14
solutions: Hi, chloegilding My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Check this link, I hope it helps https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402786...
ive done this thankyou for trying to help tho :) the guy I named sent me a link to downloads some new drivers but it hasn't worked either.

Try to return to a previous point. 1.- Open Start. 2.- Search for Create a restore point, and click the top result to open the System Properties experience.3.- Click the System Restore button. 4.- Click the Next button. 5.- Select the restore point that you want to use on your computer. 6.- Click the Scan for affected programs button to understand the apps that will no longer be available because they're added after the creation of the restore point.7.- Click the Close button. 8.- Click the Next button. 9.- Click the Finish button. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12415/...https://forums.tomshardware.com/faq/how-to-rest...https://www.isunshare.com/windows-10/7-ways-to-...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.
I'm unsure on exactly when I was trying to update my windows for a month before it workedalso because of this I don't want to undo everything I have done.

Hi chloegilding I'll try to help you out. Can you check in the device manager if the touchpad appears in the "hidden" devices (check the view tab).If not, you should check the manufacturer website if they provide any updated driver for the touchpad.I'll wait for your news Regards
there is one called PS/2 mouse would this be it?ive tried right clicking it and updating and installing but it hasn't worked
Perhaps. It may also be the external mouse (if you have one plugged in). Try to uninstall it, then reboot the computer.

the mouse I have plugged in shows as something different if I uninstall it and it is my touch pad will I be able to get it back? my manufacture doesn't offer a driver to download...it may be worth noting my partner has the exact same laptop as me is there a way we can copy the driver over?

Well, if the touchpad isn't working, uninstall it will just "delete" the driver.At the next startup, windows will install it again. Check if this improves the issue. If not, search for the make and model of the touchpad (check the "device properties"). It may be "elantech", or "synaptics", etc.Then go to the related manufacturer's website to download the correct driver.
Also, there is actually a way to "save" driver from another computer, but unfortunately I don't remember how. We'll have to search a tutorial online.

windows.symptom: Sudden unwanted screen dimming        I just noticed that my screen is very dim.  I updated the drivers and it installed and seemed to fix it, but then I noticed it was slowly getting dimmer.  I checked the setting on the tv, and it is at 50.  So I switched over to the other hdmi inputs, and the others were about 45 and alot brighter.  When I switched back, the brightness was fine, but then would slowly dim again.  I checked windows settings, and could not find any brightness controls, and there is no adaptive brightness setting.  Power saving is off, and at high performance.  I tried the brightness setting in the Radeon app, but it just seems to make everything lighter, not brighter.  Any help will be greatly appreciated
solutions: Hi German. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.1) There are changes in Brightness settings as of Version 1903, with sliders now only in Settings > System > Display and in the Action Center via Windows (flag) key + A.2) See fixes for brightness controls not working: https://fossbytes.com/how-to-fix-windows-10-bri...https://www.kapilarya.com/fix-cant-change-scree...https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/44213-adjus...https://www.trickyways.com/2019/06/fix-screen-b...https://windows101tricks.com/windows-10-brightn...3) Update the Display driver from the PC or Display adapter maker's Support Downloads web page for your exact model number, HP Serial Number or Dell Service Tag - from the sticker on the PC.While there check also for newer chipset, BIOS/UEFI firmware (very important), network, sound, USB3 and other drivers, comparing to the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu.If this doesn't give you the latest or ideal driver for what you need, compare it to the driver offered by the Intel driver update Utility here:http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/... or the Nvidia Update utility here: http://www.nvidia.com/Download/Scan.aspx?lang=e... or the AMD autodect utility here: http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/windows/P... For Display issues one fix that is working is to Roll back or Uninstall the Driver on the Display Device > Driver tab, restart PC to reinstall driver.You can also try older drivers in Device Manager > Display device > Driver tab > Update Driver > Browse > Let Me Pick.Then you will know you've tried everything in addition to Windows Update drivers.4) If this was caused by Windows Update(s) then you can check which were installed at Settings>Update & Security>Windows Update under Update History, then uninstall them from the link there, and immediately check for these again and hide with the Hide Updates tool explained here: https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta... You can also go into Repair Mode by whichever method works here: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/2294-advanc... to use the new Uninstall Updates button in Advanced Troubleshoot Options:https://pureinfotech.com/uninstall-updates-adva... You can also use System Restore from within Windows or the above Repair Mode to get back before the problem began, then check for Updates with the Hide Update tool and hide them:https://www.windowscentral.com/how-use-system-r... 5) If this was caused by a Version Update then for 10 days you can roll it back in Settings>Update & Security>Recovery and then hide it until it matures using the Hide Updates Tool which is explained more here:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta....If that doesn't work you can also Go Back in Repair Mode as shown here: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/2294-advanc...6) Many appreciated previously having Sliders also in the Power Plan settings which could be set separately for Plugged In and on Battery. If you're wanting this feature back you can express your opinion on this to Microsoft via the Feedback Hub app in Start Menu, where developers are tasked to process consumer feedback. They will not even see it here. This is a tech forums staffed mostly by volunteers trying to help others with your problems.If you want to post back a Share link from your Feedback here others who see this thread can vote it up and add to it.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to rate my post, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Public Desktop Folder Name        "Under users\Public Folder I have a folder with the name of : "Desktop"Should that Be "Public Desktop"?In the Desktop folder there is a "Desktop.ini" file which contains: [.ShellClassInfo] LocalizedResourceName=@%SystemRoot%\system32\shell32.dll,-21799I looked up 21799 in a program and it says Shell32.dll gives "Public Desktop"Should I be seeing "Public Desktop" or "Desktop"?
solutions: Hi Cal Do you have 'Hidden Items showing on the View Ribbon in File Explorer? If so, you should be seeing a hidden folder named Public Desktop in that Public folder, all folders in the Public folder, with the exception of Libraries and Roaming should begin with Public . . .

I do have 'Hidden Items showingThanks for letting me know the displayed name should be prefixed with "Public". That removes one unknown.Left is the fact that desktop.ini seems to contain the correct indexand my shell32.dll seems to specify "Public Desktop" for that indexI still wonder why the displayed name is simply "Desktop"I wonder if a desktop.ini file must have certain attributes to be effective.My desktop.ini is owned by Admnistrators(LAPTOP)\AdministratorsI wonder if that is correct?I (only) have "Special" access Users (LAPTOP)\Users have Read & execute access

If you're seeing simply 'Desktop' in Explorer, then that is wrong.Per your question, the attributes of the desktop.ini file are immaterial, although Windows usually creates them with theHidden & Sytem attributes set.What is necessary for the desktop.ini file to be processed is the containing folder must have it'sReadOnly or System attribute set. So:Open an Admin PowerShell windowCopy & paste the following code (one line. Majy wrap in forum):(Get-Item 'c:\Users\Public\Desktop' -Force).Attributes += 'ReadOnly'Adding the Attributes column to FIle Explorer can be handy:Keith

windows.symptom: Why I need to rebuy Minecraft for Windows 10 "Bedrock"        I bought Minecraft "Bedrock" edition a few years ago to use it in my PC and in my Windows 10 Mobile device to play with my children. Thankfully you people haven´t yet killed the Mobile version. But I just found out that I need to rebuy the "Bedrock" edition game either the Starter Pack or the Master Collection to be able to use it without problems. Why you people have to keep milking people´s pockets like this, I´m really getting to a point were I´ll simply dump everything Microsoft and go with another brand. Shame on you people.
solutions: Hi, My name is Will i'm an independent adviser. It's not "you people" here, this is the community forum. You do not need the Starter Pack or Master Collection to play the game. These contain the base game, which it sounds like you already own. And a number of cosmetic only skin packs and some of the Minecoin premium currency used to purchase the more of the same. You can continue the play the base game on its own or with others who have the base or Starter Pack/Master Collection versions without any issues.I hope that helps.

And yet, it shows a warning that it only allows for 90 minute gameplay, which of course happens, and if they try to play in the local LAN, it opens a window offering to buy either the Starter Pack or the Master Collection. As I see it, and it might have happened some time ago, Microsoft and Mojang divided the Mobile from the Desktop versions of "Bedrock" edition. My guess, to make it easier to dump the Mobile version when Nadella want to finally pull the plug. And of course they took the liberty to charge as if the desktop version was a completely new purchase.

It sounds like your PC copy is only a trial then. Separate versions and purchases on different platforms is standard practice for games. There aren't many exceptions to this even in cross-save and cross-platform titles. If you do not own the PC bedrock edition you will need to buy it. Only the accounts have been cross-save the purchase has always been separate.

No, it is, or was, a full purchased copy. I bought it like 5 years ago, almost right when it was launched. I remember it was about $30, mobile version was slightly less back then. Anyway, seems Microsoft and Mojang are playing the game of squeezing the juice out of everyone´s pockets and honestly I´m not up to it.
Either way this isn't an issue we can help with on the community forum. I suggest getting in touch with Mojang directly to provide feedback or request help with your purchase.

windows.symptom: Windows Media Center Electronic Program Guide Alternatives        I've recently received a popup on my Windows Media Center home screen stating that the Electronic Program Guide will not be available after January 2020.  I've long expected this day.  The popup gives you a click option for alternatives to the EPG, but the link it takes you to is a nothing link for generic guide troubleshooting (I got the same popup on my Windows Media Center Extender.  Clicking on it rebooted the extender).Are any 3rd party EPG alternatives even in the works?  I am trying to figure what my next DVR setup will be and need to get on it.  Am thinking of getting an Amazon Recast box, but kind of want to see if they have a second generation (with larger HDDs) in the works.  Thinking about SiliconDust's HDHomeRun stuff, or perhaps rolling my own with Plex or something.  Again, having an EPG is paramount.  For what it's worth - I've bought into WMC since the beginning - I was the lead factory escalation engineer for a vendor's line of Media Center products - it will be like saying goodbye to an old friend, and even though it was pretty much abandoned in place for the past ten plus years, there was someone there to make sure it still was working.  Just a thank you to the Windows Home team...-Dale
solutions: Hi,For what its worth I am also a long time WMC user and hate to see it go. However, in anticipation I've set up a Plex server and have been running it in parallel with WMC the last couple of months just to see how it would work as a DVR. You had to buy a one time DVR license from Plex which I think was around $80 (it's normally more than that but they were running a special over the summer). The one time fee was another reason that I decided to try Plex versus some of the other options that had recurring fees.  Anyway, I've been using Plex with my OTA antenna and an amazon firestick and it seems to be working fine without any EPG issues like the ones that always seemed to be popping up with WMC. As an added plus I can also stream from my server to my phone which comes in handy at the gym. Regards.

So now to turn up or down my volume, refresh the page, turn up and down brightness, etc. I need to use the function key alongside the respective F key. I have ran the keyboard troubleshooter, checked for further windows updates, checked for malware, and used device manager to see if there are updates for my keyboard driver but nothing seems to work. I am running on a Lenovo Yoga 910-13IKB machine if that makes any difference.Any and all help would be greatly appreciated! solutions: Hi, Thank you for posting your concern. I am Paulo, a Community advisor. Let me assist you with as much as I can.I found this article that could resolve your concern. Please note that the steps are provided by Lenovo in this link:https://support.lenovo.com/ph/en/solutions/ht10...I hope this helps with your concern.

Hello, I have checked Lenovo Vantage as stated in the article but there is no section titled "input & accessories" or a setting for hotkeys. I am not sure why my Lenovo Vantage does not show this function. It is also updated to the newest version.
Hi, I apologize but I am unable to answer that as I am not knowledgeable in Lenovo's software and this is a Microsoft forum. You could contact your Manufacturer's support for any missing settings.
Is there no native setting found in Windows for this?
Hi, It is a function which is specific only to your manufacturer as they provide the customization of your keyboard.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 network - cannot connect to other computers        Two desktops, one laptop, all running the latest Win 10, all on the same workgroup.  File/printer sharing enabled.  About three weeks ago, they stopped talking to one another.  I can see the computer names in my network list.  I can open a cmd box and ping another computer successfully.  But if I try to map a drive or open one of the other computers, it says WINDOWS CANNOT ACCESS \\FRONTDESK.Running network diagnostics is useless.  It basically comes up and says yeah, you can't connect, buh-bye.I'm at my wit's end.  I have been researching this for weeks.  I've tried everything that I see suggested and I still can't use my network.Has anyone had this problem and if so, what did you do to fix it?  Thanks in advance!
solutions: Try these.Make sure required services are runningCheck to see that "Computer Browser" "TCP/IP NetBIOS Helper" "Server" and "Workstation" services are all set to Automatic and running.Check to verify correct IP address configurationsMake sure the computers are operating on the same IP address ranges, are all connecting to the right gateway, and have the right DNS settings.Disable Windows Firewall TemporarilyTemporarily disable Windows Firewall and any AV programs and see if you can then connect. If so, you know the problem is with Firewall or your AV program blocking connections.Make sure access credentials are set correctlyIf password protected sharing is enabled, make sure user accounts all have passwords and are the same usernames.
I've done all these already, no joy.  :-(

Hi Chuck,There are several reasons why you're having network issues. To help you resolve this concern, we suggest that you visit these links for troubleshooting your issue:How to use Microsoft easy fix solutions; Kindly look forFind and fix problems with viewing computers or shared files in a homegroup and click on it.Fix problems with HomeGroup after updating or upgrading to Windows 10.Let us know if you need further assistance.
We don't use homegroups.  The diagnostic tool said the same thing that running diagnostics from my desktop did:  you can't connect and we don't know why.
I'm going to bump this and hope that someone from Microsoft sees it and can help me out.  I really need to get this fixed.  We've been without a network for weeks now and we are hurting.

Hello Chuck,The issue you're experiencing might be due to the network setting changes made by a software. It would be great if you can tell us more about your concern:Did you notice any system setting changes prior to the issue?Have you tried temporarily disabling your security software?Have you installed the latest update for Windows 10?What is the current version and build number of your Windows 10 PC?Other security software may cause conflict with your network settings, we recommend temporarily disabling it and see if the issue persists. To check for the latest update for Windows 10, click theStart button, go to Settings > Update & security > Windows Update, and then select Check for updates. Click theStart button, type About your PC, and then press Enter to find out the version and build number of your Windows 10 PC. For additional troubleshooting steps for network issues in Windows 10, please refer to thislink.We're looking forward to your response.

Hello Chuck,The issue you're experiencing might be due to the network setting changes made by a software. It would be great if you can tell us more about your concern:Did you notice any system setting changes prior to the issue?Have you tried temporarily disabling your security software?Have you installed the latest update for Windows 10?What is the current version and build number of your Windows 10 PC?Other security software may cause conflict with your network settings, we recommend temporarily disabling it and see if the issue persists. To check for the latest update for Windows 10, click theStart button, go to Settings > Update & security > Windows Update, and then select Check for updates. Click theStart button, type About your PC, and then press Enter to find out the version and build number of your Windows 10 PC. For additional troubleshooting steps for network issues in Windows 10, please refer to thislink.We're looking forward to your response.We're version 1703, build 15063.332.There were no updates or system changes.  One day it was working great, next day it wasn't.I have gone so far as to uninstall AVG completely and go back to Win Defender.  I've turned the firewall off.  I've tried connecting using IDs and passwords.I've researched this on numerous other boards and there are a *LOT* of people having the same issue.To say that I am frustrated and more than moderately pissed off would be an understatement.  I just want to get this resolved.FWIW, I've included links to Dropbox files containing a fresh DxDiag scan and the results from doing an IPCONFIG scan.  Maybe you'll see something I don't.https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17565922/DxDiag.txt**Link removed for privacy*****Personal information deleted by the moderator. Please see theMicrosoft Community Frequently Asked Questions for more information on how you can protect your privacy.***

Try recreating the shares on each computer and reconfiguring the share settings. Use the properties > Sharing > advanced sharing settings dialog.Double-check: - that you're not on a public network and that you're private - the correct IP address range is configured for all computers - log on to the router settings and make sure it's not blocking any computers - ALL services are started including function provider resource host - you're using a password and not a pin to log on - all firewall/av is disabledI am convinced this is a permissions problem before anything else because you can ping the computers. That suggests that they're configured correctly to see the network but other computers can't access the shares.There has to be something that you've changed, or an update you've installed.

Try recreating the shares on each computer and reconfiguring the share settings. Use the properties > Sharing > advanced sharing settings dialog.Double-check: - that you're not on a public network and that you're private - the correct IP address range is configured for all computers - log on to the router settings and make sure it's not blocking any computers - ALL services are started including function provider resource host - you're using a password and not a pin to log on - all firewall/av is disabledI am convinced this is a permissions problem before anything else because you can ping the computers. That suggests that they're configured correctly to see the network but other computers can't access the shares.There has to be something that you've changed, or an update you've installed.Done all this already.  No joy.

Thank you for the detailed response.If the issue still persists after performing all the network troubleshooting steps from the link, we recommend performing aclean boot for both PCs. Aclean boot is performed to start Windows by using a minimal set of drivers and startup programs. This helps eliminate software conflicts that occur when you try to connect both PCs.Note: Please go through the section: How to reset the computer to start normally after clean boot troubleshooting to boot the PC in normal startup after fixing the issue.We'll be waiting for your response.

windows.symptom: Upgrade to Windows 10, from Windows 7 fails 0xC1900101 - 0X4000D        Hi All,I have failed three attempts to upgrade Windows 7 on my Acer Revo RL70. The results are the same, using the media creation tool directly, or using the tool to download the ISO and mounting that.The update fails at 89%. By fail, I mean the progress wheel stops spinning and the computer appears to freeze, on a hard shutdown and restart, it will roll back to Win7 and give the error as:0xC1900101 - 0X4000D The Installation failed in the SECOND_BOOT phase with an error during MIGRATE_DATA operation.On the most recent attempt, I used MSINFO to disable Startup Services and System Processes. solutions: Hi All,I have failed three attempts to upgrade Windows 7 on my Acer Revo RL70. The results are the same, using the media creation tool directly, or using the tool to download the ISO and mounting that.The update fails at 89%. By fail, I mean the progress wheel stops spinning and the computer appears to freeze, on a hard shutdown and restart, it will roll back to Win7 and give the error as:0xC1900101 - 0X4000D The Installation failed in the SECOND_BOOT phase with an error during MIGRATE_DATA operation.On the most recent attempt, I used MSINFO to disable Startup Services and System Processes. I also removed the AMD Graphics Drivers and Catalyst Upgrade Center from the machine. I also removed all external Hard drives. Error: 0x80070002what do I do with the Printshop CD's
Disconnect the USB keyboard and mouse dongle once the installation moved to the screen.

Disconnect the USB keyboard and mouse dongle once the installation moved to the screen.Will certainly try this on the next pass. Is there anything about the diags here that makes that stand out as an issue? Or is it something you just know can help?

There are some standard things to try.1. Uninstall antivirus software.2. Clean boot https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/929135/how-to-perform-a-clean-boot-in-windows3. Remove all none essential USB items.4. Download the ISO using the Media Creation Tool http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windows10mount the ISO image and run setup from Windows Explorer.5. Disconnect from the Internet during the upgrade.Be aware you may need a Windows 10 licence as the free upgrade period was 2015 to 2016.

Be aware you may need a Windows 10 licence as the free upgrade period was 2015 to 2016.Thanks. I'm crossing that bridge when I come to it. I have read that the upgrade still generates a valid Win10 install, but guess I will find out.
Okay, as long as you are aware.

Missing display / toggle for adaptive brightness in windows update 1809        When will be the next update to fix the problem of missing the toggle to turn off the adaptive brightness in windows update 1809? This is a big issue for me in work.  Waiting for your immediate answer. I am Using Windows 10 64 bit and currently updated to build 1809 (latest)Laptop: Acer Swift 3Thank You!
solutions: Are you talking about the Night light settings?If so go Settings, System, Display.Also you can right click on the desktop nd pick Display settings..To help us to help you and to properly get answers to your post you should include some minimum information.1.  Device type. ie Desktop, Laptop, Tablet, Surface, Phone2.  Who made it and model, RAM size, HDD size. If home built what type motherboard, Intel, AMD, other3.  OS type, Home, Pro, Enterprise, 32 bit, 64 bit, etc4.  Current build.  Hit the WIN key, type winver, hit Enter.

Are you talking about the Night light settings?If so go Settings, System, Display.Also you can right click on the desktop nd pick Display settings..To help us to help you and to properly get answers to your post you should include some minimum information.1.  Device type. ie Desktop, Laptop, Tablet, Surface, Phone2.  Who made it and model, RAM size, HDD size. If home built what type motherboard, Intel, AMD, other3.  OS type, Home, Pro, Enterprise, 32 bit, 64 bit, etc4.  Current build.  Hit the WIN key, type winver, hit Enter.No, Even it is in 100 % brightness, Still, the screen is dim and found out that the toggle to turn off the adaptive brightness is missing after the windows update 1809. I'm not the only one who experiences these bugs. Also, my other workmate

Currently using:Acer Swift 3, 12gb RAM, 1TB HDDWindows 10 64 bit, currently updated to build 1809 (latest) Hoping for your feedback. I know, you already knew that this bug/error is currently a hot topic after your Windows update build 1809
What is an Acer Swift, desktop or laptop?1809 is the version not the build.

I'm using Laptop Acer Swift 3. And thanks for the correction Sir, appreciated.I just updated the version yesterday because it is available in the windows update. Then after it was installed and restarted the laptop. Brightness became Dim even it is in 100 percent. And found out that adaptive brightness was missing in the display in the advanced settings in the battery. I search in the google and also found out that it is also the problem of the others who updated their version of Windows. So, I wanted to ask, when is the possible release of updates to fix this concern?Thank You!

The fix can be out any time as this issue is reported to Microsoft. Microsoft doesn't release a calendar of its fixes, so no timeframe can be given. But it will definitely get fixed. Just keep your Windows up to date.
Again, what is the OS build number?  hit the Windows key, type winver, hit the enter key.You will get a popup like this;

how to change from uefi to LEGACY BIOS on imac 2011 with windows 10?        I have windows 10 on my mid 2011 imac 21.5" computer. Every driver is working perfectly except for the sound drivers. I am told that the reason for this is because i downloaded windows through a efiboot, instead of a bios boot. I was wondering how i can change my boot from uefi to legacy bios on a gpt partition? It would be preferable to to not have to install and reinstall windows 10 but if there really is no other way I guess thats whats going to have to happen. i do not have a windows 10 disc as i got it through a bootable usb with the windows 10 iso on it. thank you for any and all help!
solutions: Hi, My name is Will i'm an dependant adviser. This might not be the best place for this question as the BIOS is specific to the Mac and this is a bootcamp issue an Apple forum might have more helpful user experience. With that said there's a post on the forum from not too long a go with a user experiencing a similar issue, where a moderator suggested using a program called brigadier for this purpose.For their steps please visit: https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...I hope that helps.

windows.symptom: Input not working        When I set up my headset, (with a working mic) it refuses to allow me assign it as input, however, allows me to use output. I've tried troubleshooting it, but that does no good.
solutions: Hi, Have you got the latest drivers for the headset installed? It's also worth checking if the driver software for the headset detects it. To be able to troubleshoot further can you give us the make and model of the headset?

windows.symptom: WINDOWS 10 USER PROFILES        My laptop wont update because of low space. I literally have deleted all my personal files & don't know why it still wont. I even put in an sd chip but not enough available to "MOVE" program or app from C drive to sd chip to give me enough space for my update. I did notice totally accidentally i had multiple USER PROFILES all local users. Each of these profiles have different ammounts of drive space listed. One of them was defaultuser, 1 was my user account screen name which is my Microsoft account Outlook email address, 1 just says administrator, 1 is the name of my laptop followed by some random letters, numbers,then lastly says the girls name who use to rent a room from me & just occasionally used my laptop. WILL IT MESS MY LAPTOP UP IF I DELETE ANY OF THESE? DO I NEED ALL THESE DIFFERENT PROFILES? I WOULD THINK ONLY 1 IS NEEDED IF UR THE ONLY USER? HOW FO I KNOW WHICH ONE IS THE ONE I SIGN IN ON & HAS MY STUFF ON IT? IF IT WONT DAMAGE MY LAPTOP HOW DO I DELETE THEM AND JUST INCASE Since i found it accidentally how do i even get to them again? And if deleting profiles isn't a safe option how can i free space? Ive ran disk clean up, deleted temp files/duplicate files/junk, personal files....am i missing something? I literally have only a couple personal apps installed & deleting them would still not be the 8gb im required to free???
solutions: Hi Courtney. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.I would not delete any default profiles, but certainly you can delete any unused Accounts by one of these methods:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/5464-delete...I will give you steps to free up space on smaller drives and when necessary perform version Updates on them manually by the most stable method that requires much less space than Windows Update.First here are tips for managing smaller drives including the 32-gb SSD which they should have never allowed Windows 10 be installed upon:https://www.theguardian.com/technology/askjack/...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3040404/windows...https://www.groovypost.com/howto/maximize-stora...As more space becomes needed, you can move your User folders to another internal hard drive you have or install, or Desktop, Documents and Pictures folders into OneDrive and then set them to On Demand so they reside in the cloud and only have download links on the PC: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/116029-turn...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3233488/windows...You can also offload User folders (Documents, Music, Pictures, etc) to another drive you can install on the same PC (even in the DVD drive bay) as shown in this tutorial, which will not affect speed if C is on an SSD and the other drive is not:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/1964-move-u.... I would not move program files or speed will be affected. You could also install a larger SSD/HDD.This should make enough space to install Windows Updates. But I'd focus on the latest Version update since successfully installing it will bring along all Windows Updates and also resolves almost all other problems since it reinstalls Windows keeping your files and programs in place. Install the Media Creation Tool on another PC to create bootable media or download the ISO to stick or disk, transfer it back to the target PC to open the media or click to mount the ISO, right click Setup file to Run as Administrator. This avoids needing the space to download the Upgrade and it's staging files. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Another option is to do the the best possible Clean Install in this link which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... This will give you back all but 15gb of the drive. There is also an automated Fresh Start that reinstalls WIndows while shedding corrupting factory bloatware, saves your files, but doesn't clear the drive to get it cleanest:https://www.howtogeek.com/265054/how-to-easily-... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.
What computer, How big is the disk drive?What OS build are you on?  Hit the Windows key, type winver, hit Enter.Or Windows key+r, winver, OK

Wow thank you so much for all th4 info. That was detailed in depth like id need it which was very kind. Its appreciated. Im a bit nervous honestly im not exactly an "expert" on computers. Would Windows technical support go in my computer & complete the needed work if i call or email there tech support? Id like to know before i attempt this incase i mess it up somehow i would feel more comfortable knowing it will be fixed w/out a grest deal of trouble. And i definitely want to "BACK UP" everything on it so i don't end ip Making the situation worse by losing all my data??? So can i back up using an sd card? I have a couple of them? It wont remove everything off my computer & just put on chip or will it simply copu it? After i back up i will start to work thru ur directions. So again thank you so much & if u dont mind answering my tech support BACK& UP QUESTIONS id appreciate it.

Courtney, these are necessary steps to operate a smaller hard drive, so unless you want to have a shop install a larger drive - preferable an SSD which is lightning fast - faster than a new higher end PC without one - I'd work through them yourself so you learn the methods to manage this. If you get stuck you only need to ask back as I will be here to help until this case is resolved.If you want to try Microsoft Support you can contact them on Monday by one of these phone numbers:https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405170...You can also go here: https://partner.support.services.microsoft.com/... choose the link for Browser help, interact briefly about your exact problem, keep replying "agent" until it connects with an agent.

Then i changed all my apps to store in sd other than C drive. Im unaware what apps i am able to uninstall without messing up my computer. My windows version is 1607 you have to have a more recent version to  get files on demand. I think like 162something. I checked though my version isn't updated enough
Courtney 1607 is way too old. Go back to my first post and do the upgrade to 1909 manually from Media so it will install. I'll be here to help.

windows.symptom: When I click on an app, it is locked to the toolbar, and cannot open        when tying to open an app, I click the icon on the home page.  However, the icon locks on the toolbar and I cannot open the app up.  Other apps work OK  How to correct?
solutions: Hi Stanley, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.What is the application that has the problem? If you see a message or error, please share it. Start Windows through a clean boot, it is an error-proof process, and check if the problem is repeated.https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/929135...Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Have a nice day Regards, Marc M.
